hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After News-Induced Spikes
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a major news event (e.g., Japan rate shift), a sharp, high-volume price spike (>5% in 4H) that creates a 'liquidity gap' on the order book will be followed by a mean-reversion fill of at least 50% of the gap within the next 24H, as opportunistic HFTs and market makers rebalance.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News-driven spikes often overextend due to panic/euphoria, creating temporary liquidity voids. Market makers and algos are incentivized to fade these moves to capture the wide spreads and re-establish equilibrium, providing a high-probability retracement.
entry_conditions: BTC 4H candle closes >5% from previous close on volume >150% of 20-period average
Order book snapshot shows bid-ask spread >2x 7-day average and cumulative depth imbalance >30% on the spike side
RSI(14) on 4H crosses above 80 (for long spike) or below 20 (for short spike)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial spike's range
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves beyond the high/low of the initial spike candle by 1%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Mean reversion occurs in <30% of qualifying events over a 100-sample backtest, or the average retracement is <30% of the initial gap.
